intro: Eucalyptus oleosa subsp. corvina, commonly known as the red gum, is a species of eucalyptus native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its reddish-brown bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white hair. The plant produces small, globular flower clusters that range in color from white to pale yellow. It is adapted to a variety of soil types but thrives in well-drained soils. Eucalyptus oleosa subsp. corvina is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and its ability to provide habitat for native wildlife.
